    • Method Detail

      • signIn

        public SignInReply signIn(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                 java.lang.String emailAddress,
                 @Named(value="password")
                 java.lang.String password)
                   throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException
        Sign into an existing account.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address of the account.
        password - The password of the account.
        Returns:
        SignInReply with the account and auth token.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the account was not found or the password did not match.

      • createAccount

        public BaseReply createAccount(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                      java.lang.String emailAddress,
                      @Named(value="password")
                      java.lang.String password)
                        throws StatusCodes.EmailTakenException
        Create a new account. If all goes well, this method will send an email with a verification code to complete the sign-up flow via the validateAccount(String, String, int) method.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address to create the account for.
        password - The password to use for the account.
        Returns:
        BaseReply with status code StatusCodes.OK if everything went OK.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.EmailTakenException - If the requested email address was already taken.

      • validateAccount

        public SignInReply validateAccount(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                          java.lang.String emailAddress,
                          @Named(value="password")
                          java.lang.String password,
                          @Named(value="verificationCode")
                          int verificationCode)
                            throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException,
                                   StatusCodes.IncorrectVerificationCodeException
        Validate a pending account. For this method to succeed it must be called after createAccount(String, String) and use the same email/password along with the verification code that was sent to the user's email address.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address of the account to validate.
        password - The account's password.
        verificationCode - The verification code sent to the user during the creation step.
        Returns:
        SignInReply with the account's properties if succeeded.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the pending account wasn't found.
        StatusCodes.IncorrectVerificationCodeException - If the verification code was incorrect.

      • deleteAccount

        public BaseReply deleteAccount(@Named(value="authToken")
                      java.lang.String authToken)
                        throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException,
                               StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException,
                               StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException
        Delete the currently signed-in account.
        Parameters:
        authToken - The auth token given to the user upon a successful sign-in.
        Returns:
        BaseReply with status code StatusCodes.OK if everything went OK.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the auth token points to an invalid account.
        StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException - If the auth token is malformed.
        StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException - If the auth token expired.

      • regenerateValidationCode

        public BaseReply regenerateValidationCode(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                                 java.lang.String emailAddress,
                                 @Named(value="password")
                                 java.lang.String password)
                                   throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException
        Create a new validation code for a pending account. For this method to succeed, an account must have been created using the createAccount(String, String) method and not yet validated via validateAccount(String, String, int).
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address of the account.
        password - The password set during the account creation.
        Returns:
        BaseReply with status code StatusCodes.OK if everything went OK.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the account was not found in the pending accounts table.

      • signOut

        public BaseReply signOut(@Named(value="authToken")
                java.lang.String authToken)
        Sign out an account, never fails unless the auth token is malformed.
        Parameters:
        authToken - The auth token given to the user upon a successful sign-in.
        Returns:
        BaseReply with status code StatusCodes.OK.

      • getAccount

        public GetAccountReply getAccount(@Named(value="authToken")
                         java.lang.String authToken)
                           throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException,
                                  StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException,
                                  StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException
        Get the account properties.
        Parameters:
        authToken - The auth token given to the user upon a successful sign-in.
        Returns:
        A GetAccountReply with the account properties.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the account to change wasn't found.
        StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException - If the auth token is not a valid token.
        StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException - If the auth token expired.

      • modifyAccount

        public GetAccountReply modifyAccount(@Named(value="authToken")
                            java.lang.String authToken,
                            @Nullable@Named(value="password")
                            java.lang.String password,
                            @Nullable@Named(value="name")
                            java.lang.String name,
                            @Nullable@Named(value="accountType")
                            java.lang.Integer accountType,
                            @Nullable@Named(value="phoneNumber")
                            java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                            @Nullable@Named(value="address")
                            java.lang.String address)
                              throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException,
                                     StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException,
                                     StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException
        Override one or more properties of an account.
        Parameters:
        authToken - The auth token given to the user upon a successful sign-in.
        password - The new password to set, null if no change.
        name - The new name associated with the account, null if no change.
        accountType - The new account type, null if no change.
        phoneNumber - The new phone number, null if no change.
        address - The new address, null if no change.
        Returns:
        A GetAccountReply with the new account properties.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the account to change wasn't found.
        StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException - If the auth token is not a valid token.
        StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException - If the auth token expired.

      • resetPasswordRequest

        public BaseReply resetPasswordRequest(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                             java.lang.String emailAddress)
                               throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException
        Initiates the password reset steps. When this method is called and completes successfully, a verification code will be associated with the account and emailed to the account holder. The account holder will then be able to use the code to create a new password via the resetPassword(String, int, String) method.
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address to reset the password for.
        Returns:
        A BaseReply with status code StatusCodes.OK if everything went OK.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the email is not associated with an account.

      • resetPassword

        public BaseReply resetPassword(@Named(value="emailAddress")
                      java.lang.String emailAddress,
                      @Named(value="verificationCode")
                      int verificationCode,
                      @Named(value="password")
                      java.lang.String password)
                        throws StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException,
                               StatusCodes.GenericInternalError,
                               StatusCodes.IncorrectVerificationCodeException
        Resets the password associated with a given account. This method must only be called after a successful call to resetPasswordRequest(String).
        Parameters:
        emailAddress - The email address to reset the password to.
        verificationCode - The verification code generated by resetPasswordRequest(String) and sent to the correct email address.
        password - The new password to set for the account.
        Returns:
        BaseReply with a status code StatusCodes.OK if everything was successful.
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.AccountNotFoundException - If the email is not associated with an existing account.
        StatusCodes.GenericInternalError - If there is no record of the account having requested a password reset.
        StatusCodes.IncorrectVerificationCodeException - If the verification code used is incorrect.

        public static AuthTokenEntity validateAuthToken(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.DatastoreService datastore,
                                java.lang.String authToken,
                                java.util.Date now)
                                         throws StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException,
                                                StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException
        Throws:
        StatusCodes.InvalidAuthTokenException
        StatusCodes.SessionExpiredException
